name: The Canyon Wren - Cabins for Two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent two nights at the Canyon Wren cabins and absolutely loved the place. The property is extremely well kept and the interior layouts are very unique. The continental breakfasts are homemade and Mike is quite the baker. All in all a very restful little place tucked away in the Canyon.
reviews.title: A very nice place

likes.disliked: — Absolutely no cell service or internet capability

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is by far the best place to stay if you are in Sedona or the Oak Creek Canyon area. The owners, Mike and Milena are the friendliest, most down to earth people you could find. Whether we wanted a restaurant recommendation or place to go hike, they were very well informed. Mike's homemade muffins are great, the brownies are to die for!!! They made us feel like their kids on our week long trip. I would definately stay here for any trip.
reviews.title: The Best Honeymoon We Could Have Asked For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We go to Oak Creek Canyon every year or so to get out of the heat and return to nature. We have stayed at places on the creek ranging from townhouses to cabins with gourmet meals to a fairly luxurious hotel, but we had never heard of Canyon Wren Cabins. We looked at the site this year and decided to book a cabin.
reviews.title: Communing with Nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Canyon Wren was everything we wanted and more. The cabins are made for two people and they are very romantic and cozy. We stayed in Morning Glory and had our own private back yard surrounded by trees and birds. The owners have a separte garden in which everyone can sit if they want and the birds just flock to the feeding area, allowing you to watch them without being intrusive or being soiled. The birds feel so safe they will simply eat without being bothered. We had numerous hummingbirds come and actually sit at their feeder by our breakfast nook. There are fountains everywhere. There is nothing like being awakened late in the morning by a bird calling, a dog barking and the fountain running. We were able to sleep late and gracefully and peacefully awaken.
reviews.title: What a great weekend !!

likes.disliked: — Not one thing that we did not like !!!

reviews.title: Best Place ever !!
reviews.text: Our cabin was wonderfully appointed with a ceiling fan, a cooling system (we did not need or want air conditioning), an indoor jacuzzi and a very efficient kitchen. The bedroom was upstairs (the queen size bed was very comfortable) and the living room and kitchen downstairs. We had total privacy. The owners were very friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the Canyon Wren in their Honeysuckle Cabin. The proprietors and their staff were great, the cabin was charming and we would certainly stay at the property again when we go back to Sedona.
reviews.title: Would Stay Again! Nice, relaxing retreat

likes.disliked: — Bed and bedding could be upgraded, but they do the trick.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: The property is a few miles out of town on a 2-lane road. This worked for us, but should be considered in your planning. It was great for our needs as it put us closer to the hiking and outdoor activities we wanted to do during the day. It only took us about 5-8 minutes to get into town for dinner.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Staff: We were greeted by the very friendly and helpful Carolyn. The owners and staff are available, but not at all intrusive. We felt well taken care of, but also felt like we got loads of privacy (I didn't actually run into any other guests either!).
reviews.title: Magical Experience
For people who love to be together
reviews.text: Cabins: We loved our log cabin (Honeysuckle), but the chalets looked inviting as well. Note that the 2-lane road runs right along side the property such that the Honeysuckle and Wild Rose are closest to the passing car sounds (which are by no means extreme). So for those who might be bothered about that, the Morning Glory or Sycamore might be a better bet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kitchen: Fully stocked with the items you'd need to cook. All you need is groceries from in town. Coffee with maker, creamers and sugar is provided.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Mike and Milena for creating an incredible B&B! We were celebrating out 25th anniversary and were in need of a get away weekend. The Canyon Wren Cabins nestled just 6 miles from Sedona in the Oak Creek Canyon, this place is a gem. We found the cabin cozy and tranquil. The grounds were very well kept and the cabins are very clean. The incredible homemade baked goods and fresh fruit was a perfect breakfast. At night we were lulled to sleep by the water fountain on our patio. Mike and Milena were the perfect hosts and it was a delight talking with then over breakfast. Of all the places we have visited this place will be with us forever and we are going to put the Canyon Wren Cabins first on our list for our getaway weekends.
reviews.title: Wonderful Cabins and Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mike & Milena were the perfect hosts. My boyfriend & I stayed here for a week & couldn't have found a more lovely spot to enjoy a week away from it all. We were pampered & tended to with much care. I would recommend this clean, cozy, friendly place to stay to any one looking for a get away with the one you love. We stayed in the smallest cabin, Honeysuckle. I loved looking through the window or sitting on the porch and watching the MANY hummingbirds that enjoyed the feeder on our front porch. This place is right next door to Slide Rock Park & only a short drive away from uptown Sedona. The breakfast was always amazing if you enjoy baked goods - Mike makes amazing muffins & out of this world brownies - I don't know how Milena keeps her tiny figure! We loved it & met a wonderful couple there who had been back 4 times! You should go!
reviews.title: Home away from home

likes.disliked: — no tv - we stayed during the olympics :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the reviews are true, Milina and Mike have created an oasis for us to visit complete with gardens, hummingbirds, the world's best brownies and a view of the canyon. It's also a great place to take day trips from; Milina will help you with your plans and make sure it is a good fit for you. Oak Creek Canyon is a great place for a hike and views of the canyon from the canyon floor. It started our trip off with special feelings that will stay with us forever.
reviews.title: Worth repeating!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife of 14 years have just returned from Sedona,AZ for a weekend getaway. We were searching the internet for a nice cozy place to stay, away from all the daily activities and stresses. With two teenagers, busy schedules, hectic jobs, and conflicting schedules, we needed some alone time with each other to rekindle a romance that was starting to fade away. We found Canyon Wren Cabins for Two on a Google search and i thought to myself, this is perfect! My wife called the 800# given on the website and she talked to Milena. She was very nice on the telephone and very accommodating to our needs. We booked and off we went. Having been to Sedona many times, we had no problem finding the cabins, other then passing them by the first time. Six miles from the exit of Main Sedona was exactly the right mileage. We arrived with a pleasant welcome from Milena and Mike the owners of the property. Milena gave us the complete top to bottom tour of our cabin which was the Wild Rose Cabin. The cabin was immaculate and just cozy, very well kept and everything for a romantic weekend was in place. The hummingbird feeder outside the breakfast table was a nice touch in the mornings. My expectations were exceeded by how much detail was put into these cabins. Every morning we would wake up at the crack of dawn to enjoy the bird sanctuary on site. Just sitting on the swings and enjoying nature and all its quiet beauty was enough to bring us back. We are already planning to come back sometime this October to stay at the same cabin. Definitely recommended to anyone who needs a quiet getaway with no disturbances from televisions, telephones, computers, kids, traffic, work and anything else getting in the way of romance. Oh yeah and as far as the romance with me and my wife, it was sparked up like a wildfire! wink wink.
reviews.title: What a little slice of Heaven!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, attention to detail, hosts, food.

reviews.text: We absolutely loved our stay at Canyon Wren for our honeymoon. Mike and Melinda are gems! They were so kind and knowledgeable, just a wellspring of information on anything you want to know or do in Sedona. The Cabins were always clean, comfortable, and stocked with anything you could need. The area was breathtakingly beautiful! We look forward to being able to come back again, if only just for Mike's amazing muffins and brownies! -The Smiths
reviews.title: Honeymoon Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had such a relaxing time! The scenery was beautiful and the cabin was clean, cozy, and romantic. We were welcomed by a thorough tour of the cabins and brownies...YUM! We enjoyed watching hummingbirds out our window and falling asleep to waterfalls. Breakfast was delicious homemade muffins, fruit, juice, and coffee. We enjoyed Mike and Milena's company at breakfast. They are warm and hospitable people. We had a very relaxing time and feel rejuvinated "to do life" back at home.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Welcoming, Hospitable, Cozy

likes.disliked: — great muffins, brownies...gained some pounds. LOL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there only one night, but it is one of the best bed and breakfasts' we've stayed in. The chalet type cabins are cozy, neat, and clean, with alot of attention to detail. You can tell Mike and Milena take pride in their place and are both just super nice people.
reviews.title: one excellent bed and breakfast

likes.liked: — well run, clean, attention to detail
likes.disliked: — hmm......there was nothing there that I didn't like or can remember not liking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your coming from the Flagstaff area the cabins are nestled in the canyon before you actually get to into Sedona, but are still just a short drive away from town. It was a very relaxing stay and it was nice just to sit out on the porch in the evening and watch the many hummingbirds zip around. If your in the Sedona area, and would like a charming, quiet, clean, and relaxing place to stay, we highly recommend the Canyon Wren!
reviews.title: Best getaway for couples in Sedona

likes.disliked: — Cabins were not on the creek--it's across the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are longtime residents of Arizona and have visited the gorgeous Sedona area many times, but this was our first stay at the Canyon Wren, and what a little treasure it is! We were looking for a couples-only cabin for a weekend visit, that would not cost a fortune, and did we hit the jackpot. Milena and Mike are the warm and gracious hosts, and will make you feel right at home. They have both lived in the Sedona/Oak Creek area for years and have a wealth of information to offer, if you need some guidance on hikes, recreation, shopping, restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Beyond Expectations

likes.disliked: — We had to leave so soon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cabin we rented was unlike any we've stayed at before, and we've stayed in plenty all over this state. Most people think of the term "rustic" when describing a cabin, but Canyon Wren's can only be described as quaint and home-like. There are so many little personal touches, inside and out, that you can't help but be relaxed and comfortable. Also it was clean, and I mean spotless, which is very important to me. There are no televisions or telephones (we enjoyed the reprieve) and the entire property is non-smoking. Nothing is more annoying to a non-smoker than sitting on the deck and having to deal with your neighbor's second-hand smoke wafting over.
reviews.title: Canyon Wren is a wonderful getaway!

likes.liked: — Quiet, nice atmosphere, beautiful cabins and landscaping

aka: The Canyon Wren - Cabins For Two Hotel
description: Nestled beneath red rock cliffs, the Canyon Wren Cabins beckons you to a unique getaway from the distractions of daily life. Each 500 square foot individual cabin is just the right size for one or two adults. Enjoy birds and bird feeders, fountains, trees and flowers...an oasis amidst the sycamore trees. Creek access to guests and a wonderful continental plus breakfast provided. Just the right distance from the bustle of Sedona. Original owners of 26 years offer concierge service and are a great source of information for your special vacation time.
